title: Phishing Email Detection with LLMs
summary: Built and evaluated a large language model (LLM)-based system to identify phishing emails using pre-labeled datasets from Virginia Tech and other sources.

description.situation: Phishing emails continue to bypass traditional filters, prompting the need for smarter detection tools.
description.task: Build an LLM-based system that can classify phishing emails using real-world datasets.
description.action: I fine-tuned LLaMa and Gemma on email corpora, evaluated performance, and visualized results through a Python dashboard.
description.result: The models improved detection rates and demonstrated the promise of language-based approaches to cybersecurity.

challenges: Balancing dataset quality between real user data and phishing corpora.
Normalizing perplexity outputs across model types.
Conveying confidence in predictions while avoiding false positives.
contributions: Integrated and fine-tuned open-source LLMs using PyTorch.
Developed a scalable testing framework to compare F1-scores.
Led all data preprocessing and scoring logic for classification.
